title: Indigenous high-voltage alternating current lines may be deployed to boost transmission infrastructure
description: India aimed to expand and upgrade its transmission infrastructure by deploying 1,200 kV high-voltage AC lines. This technology, tested in 2016, is considered cost-effective and faster for short distances. The Central Transmission Utility will identify potential corridors, while efforts are underway to address deployment challenges, focusing on rising electricity demand and renewable energy integration.
